page.title: 15CHANGES IN FARMING
page.content: On the farms over the past 20 years there have been many changes, like new chemicals & high technology, new machinery, new crops & new types of fruit trees. Workers used to hoe the crops by hand but weed killer sprays are perhaps the main change. The work force is only one third of the 1960 number. Oil seed rape is a fairly new crop grown for oil (cooking oil & margarine). There are not so many cherry orchards as there were, as it costs too much to harvest them. The farmers are now planting smaller trees which are easier to pick. The straw- berries are picked in 12 pound trays & are taken for freezing to be used later for fruit yoghurt. Contractors from New Zealand help shear the thousands of sheep, some shearing 150 a day. Rabbits are becoming a great pest again. These are times of change.
